admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Extension Project for
            the Syrian Arab Republic was cancelled on November 5, 1986.
            The project was to be financed jointly by the Bank loan and
            a corresponding loan from the International Fund for
            Agricultural Development (IFAD). The Syrian Government
            ratified the IFAD portion in early 1986, but ultimately
            rejected ratification of the Bank portion. Although no
            official reasons were given for the cancellation of this
            project, Syrian officials reported that the principal reason
            was concern over the number of vehicles proposed for the
            project. The Syrian Government considered the number of
            vehicles to be excessive, although this issue had not been
            raised during negotiations. While the Government continued
            to recognize the importance of strengthening the extension
            services in the agriculture sector, they claimed that
            economic and fiscal difficulties warranted a reduced
            project. Indeed, economic and fiscal conditions in Syria
            deteriorated in late 1985 and 1986. This led not only to the
            postponement and eventual cancellation of this project, but
            also to a suspension of all disbursements of the Bank to
            Syria in June 1986 due to growing arrears on loan
            repayments. The project is not rated and will not be audited.
